contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox kommune | name = Svelvik | native_name = | native_name_lang = | other_name = | official_name = | idnumber = 0711 | image_skyline = Svelvik.jpg | county = Vestfold | district = | capital = Svelvik | language = [[Bokmål]] | coatofarms = Svelvik_komm.svg | demonym = Svelviking | munwebpage = www.svelvik.kommune.no | mayor = Knut Erik Lippert | mayor_party = [[Conservative Party of Norway|H]] | mayor_as_of = 2003 | area_rank = 419 | area_total_km2 = 58 | area_land_km2 = 56 | area_water_percent = 0.02 | population_as_of = 2004 | population_rank = 153 | population_total = 6445 | populationpercent = 0.14 | population_density_km2 = 115 | population_increase = 8.1 | latd = 59 | latm = 37 | lats = 25 | longd = 10 | longm = 22 | longs = 18 | utm_zone = 32V | utm_northing = 6610310 | utm_easting = 0577378 | geo_cat = adm2nd }} {{Audio|Svelvik.ogg|'''Svelvik'''}} is a [[List of cities in Norway|town]] and [[Municipalities of Norway|municipality]] in [[Vestfold]] [[Counties of Norway|county]], [[Norway]]. The administrative centre of the municipality is the town of Svelvik. The town of Svelvik was separated from the rural municipality of [[Strømm]] to become a municipality of its own in 1845. The two municipalities were merged back together on 1 January 1964. ==General information== ===Name=== The [[Norse language|Norse]] form of the name was ''Sverðvík''. The first element is ''sverð'' n '[[sword]]', the last element is ''vík'' f '[[cove]], wick'. A neighbouring farm has the name Sverstad (Norse ''Sverðstaðir''). The word ''sverð'' is probably referring to the promontory ridge ''Ryggen'' ('the back') in [[Hurum]]: This ridge is lying right opposite Svelvik and Sverstad, and it is almost (like a sword) cutting the [[Drammensfjord]] in two parts.<ref>{{cite book|title=Norske gaardnavne: Jarlsberg og Larviks amt|edition=6|authorlink=Oluf Rygh|last=Rygh|first=Oluf|publisher=W. C. Fabritius & sønners bogtrikkeri|year=1907|location=Kristiania, Norge|pages=|url=http://books.google.com/books?id=3YpBAAAAIAAJ}} {{no icon}}</ref> ===Coat-of-arms=== The [[Coat of arms|coat-of-arms]] is from modern times. They were granted on 4 September 1964. Svelvik is an important [[harbor]] and its economy is thus also based on the harbor. The arms show a gold-colored [[trident]] on a red background, as a symbol for the sea.<ref>{{cite web|author=Norske Kommunevåpen|year=1990|title=Nye kommunevåbener i Norden|url=http://www.ngw.nl/int/nor/s/svelvik.htm|accessdate=2009-01-14}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.svelvik.kommune.no/Asp/svelvik/svelvik.nsf/id/5D194D78FB561942C12572F3004FF862?OpenDocument|title=Kommunevåpenet|publisher=Svelvik kommune|accessdate=2009-01-14}} {{no icon}}</ref> ==Geography== [[Image:TRS 070414 014.jpg|left|thumb|The Svelvik ferry line is the shortest in Norway.]] The narrow Svelvikstrømmen [[sound (geography)|sound]] separates Svelvik from the municipality of [[Hurum]], and the county of [[Buskerud]]. This sound is served by a [[ferry]], which has the shortest line in Norway. The village is quite characteristic, with small winding streets and traditional, white-painted houses. Svelvik is a summer paradise with many possibilities for swimming and sunbathing. ==Famous inhabitants== * [[Steffen Martinsen]], football player * [[Martin Nymoen]], winner of NorgesCup in [[Mountain bike]] * [[Peter Espevoll]], lead singer of death metal band [[Extol]] ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== *{{commonscat-inline|Svelvik}} *{{wti|Svelvik}} *[http://www.ssb.no/english/municipalities/0711 Municipal fact sheet] from [[Statistics Norway]] *{{Wikivoyage-inline|Vestfold}} {{Vestfold}} [[Category:Municipalities of Vestfold]] [[Category:Populated places in Vestfold]] [[Category:Cities and towns in Norway]] [[Category:Svelvik| ]]
